title: 103_hr929
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SIMPLIFICATION OF EMPLOYMENT TAXES ON DOMESTIC SERVICES." is about simplifying employment taxes related to domestic services. Increase in Threshold Requirement for wages and Social Security Act to $300. Coordination of Collection of Domestic Service Employment with Income Taxes under Chapter 25 of the Internal Revenue Code. Chapter 25 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new section on the collection of income taxes related to employment taxes. Section 3510 discusses the coordination of collecting domestic service employment taxes with income taxes. Section 3510 discusses the coordination of collecting domestic service employment taxes with income taxes. Returns for domestic service employment taxes are filed on a calendar year basis, due on the 15th day of the fourth month following the close of the employer's taxable year. No deposit requirements apply to these taxes. Domestic service employment taxes are subject to estimated tax provisions for section 6654. For section 6654 purposes, domestic service employment taxes are treated as taxes imposed by chapter 2 for the employer's taxable year. Adjustments may be made under regulations for annualization. A transitional rule applies for applying section 6654 to a taxable year beginning in 1994. For section 6654 purposes, domestic service employment taxes include taxes imposed on remuneration for domestic service in a private home and amounts withheld under section 3402(p). The term 'domestic service in a private home of the employer' excludes service described in section 3121(g)(5). This section may not apply to an employer liable for other employment taxes. The Secretary will create necessary regulations for this section. The Secretary is authorized to enter into agreements with states to collect state unemployment taxes on remuneration paid for domestic service in a private home. The Secretary can collect state unemployment taxes on remuneration for domestic service in a private home through agreements with states. Taxes collected will be treated as domestic service employment taxes and transferred to the state's account in the Unemployment Trust Fund. The collected amount will be considered a tax imposed by chapter 23 for subtitle F purposes. The term "State" is defined in this subsection as per section 3306(j)(1). A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 25 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to remuneration paid in calendar years after 1993.
